channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Very difficult': Melania on conversation with Barron Trump about assassination attempt on Donald
item.description: On a question on how was Melania's conversation with Barron when Donald Trump was shot at in Pennsylvania, Melania said it was a very difficult discussion. Barron was playing outside and he rushed inside. On the day of the second assassination attempt, Melania said she was in New York city and she saw it on television. "I called him and he was okay. The Secret Service guys were with him, they were great, fantastic," Melania said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brazil's drought drives coffee and sugar prices to record highs amid global supply concerns
item.description: Brazil's severe drought continues to impact its coffee and sugar production, driving global prices to new highs. Farmland fires and damage to the arabica crop are significant issues. Some rain is forecasted but may not arrive until mid-to-late October. Vietnam's robusta coffee output might alleviate some price pressures despite earlier weather challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When LeBron James said 'Ain't no party like Diddy party' in resurfaced video
item.description: ​​Diddy has not pleaded guilty to three felony counts and has been refused bail. His arrest would open a can of worms as several celebrities were linked to him and apparently took part in his Freak Off parties. But no one has yet been implicated and just taking part in his Freak Offs won't mean they were also involved in trafficking.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Chill the f**k out': Woman 'steals' man's Apple charger on JetBlue flight, says she was going to give it back
item.description: ​As the video posted by the man went viral now showing the woman as an unscrupulous thief, Vanessa, the woman, shared her side of the story. She said the incident took place almost over a year ago but now that the man's video went viral on TikTok, she was bombarded with harassment and hence felt the need to come up with a clarification.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'There are consequences if ... ': Russia widens nuclear weapons doctrine, issues warning to West
item.description: The Kremlin has updated its nuclear doctrine, allowing for the use of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states under certain conditions. This change is aimed at countries supporting Ukraine in its conflict with Russia. The revised policy expands the list of military threats that could justify a nuclear response and includes more states and alliances.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel rejects ceasefire plans, says goal to 'crush' Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description: Israeli finance minister Bezalel Smotrich has turned down a 21-day ceasefire proposal, stating that the offensive should conclude with Hezbollah's defeat. The US and its allies had suggested the ceasefire to prevent further escalation. Israeli airstrikes have hit multiple Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, as concerns about a full-scale war grow.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kate Middleton reaches out to 'homesick' Prince Harry after spotting 'worrying signs': Report
item.description: On September 15, Prince Harry turned 40 and received birthday wishes from Kate Middleton and Prince William. Kate crafted the message to help restore peace between Harry and his family amid ongoing tensions. The gesture was appreciated by Harry, who celebrated with his family in California before attending a gathering with friends.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taliban calls gender discrimination claims 'absurd' as four nations push for legal action
item.description: The Taliban have denied allegations of gender discrimination and human rights abuses amid plans by Australia, Canada, Germany, and the Netherlands to take legal action against them. These countries seek to hold Afghanistan accountable under international law for its treatment of women and girls. The initiative has garnered support from over 20 nations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Alabama schedules second Nitrogen gas execution amid controversy
item.description: Alabama is preparing for its second nitrogen gas execution amid debates on the method's humaneness. The first use in January led to a painful death for Kenneth Smith, raising constitutional concerns. Alam Eugene Miller, convicted of triple murder, is scheduled next. Critics urge further evaluation before proceeding with more executions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I also ... ': What Elon's mother said on Musk-Meloni dating rumours
item.description: Maye Musk addressed the rumours of her son, Elon Musk, dating Georgia Meloni after a viral photo led to public speculation. She clarified that she was seated next to Elon and admired Meloni. Elon Musk also denied the claims. The rumours were fueled by his praise for Meloni at an awards ceremony in New York.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jhumpa Lahiri turns down award over New York museum's kaffiyeh ban
item.description: Jhumpa Lahiri, an India-origin author, has declined the 2024 Isamu Noguchi Award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens. This move is in protest against the museum's updated dress code policy, which resulted in firing three employees for wearing kaffiyehs to show solidarity with Palestinians. The policy bans clothing or accessories displaying political messages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden wants to make active shooter drills in schools less traumatic for students
item.description: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order to help schools develop less traumatic but effective active shooter drills. The order also seeks to limit technologies that make guns easier to fire and obtain. A task force will investigate machine-gun-conversion devices and 3D-printed guns, reflecting Biden's ongoing commitment to curbing gun violence.

item.title: UK shortlists four developers including Rolls Royce for small nuclear projects
item.description: Britain has advanced Rolls Royce, GE-Hitachi Nuclear Energy, Westinghouse, and Holtec Britain in its competition to develop small modular nuclear reactors. The government plans to select two companies for deployment in the 2030s. This initiative aims to replace older plants with more cost-effective and faster-to-build SMRs to meet net zero targets.

item.title: World's longest-serving death row prisoner proven innocent in Japan
item.description: Iwao Hakamada, once a professional boxer, was acquitted after spending nearly half a century on death row for a crime he did not commit. DNA evidence revealed his innocence, leading to his release in 2014. His case has exposed significant flaws in Japan's legal system and sparked debates over its reliance on confessions and use of the death penalty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Shocking revelations about Vince McMahon made by popular WWE Superstars
item.description: Recent revelations by WWE stars shed light on Vince McMahon's controversial management style. Incidents include asking Shane McMahon to stab him during a backstage dispute, overworking wrestlers without breaks, and regularly booking talent to lose in their hometowns. These disclosures offer a troubling glimpse into the practices behind WWE's success.
item.dc:creator: Sameer Khan

item.title: 'I don't think ...': What JD Vance said about his upcoming debate against opponent Tim Walz
item.description: JD Vance, the Republican Vice Presidential nominee, claims minimal preparation is needed for his upcoming debate against Tim Walz as he focuses on Trump's policies and criticizes Kamala Harris. Conversely, Walz is preparing extensively at a multiday camp in Michigan. The debate is set for October 1 and will be hosted by CBS.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taliban could face Hague tribunal for their treatment of women and girls
item.description: Australia, Canada, Germany, and The Netherlands are set to initiate legal proceedings against the Taliban government over violations of women's rights in Afghanistan. The case may go to the International Court of Justice. Since August 2021, Afghan women have faced severe restrictions under Taliban rule. This unprecedented move has garnered international support and condemnation of the Taliban's actions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine President making nasty aspersions toward your favorite president, me: Trump
item.description: Donald Trump criticized President Biden's approach to the Russia-Ukraine war, suggesting Ukraine should have made concessions before the invasion. He argued any deal would be better than the current situation. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy expressed doubts about Trump's ability to end the conflict and plans to present a victory plan to the White House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 21-year-old rock climber dies in tragic fall from Devils Tower in US
item.description: A 21-year-old climber named Stewart Phillip Porter from Wisconsin fell to his death while rappelling down Devils Tower National Monument in Wyoming. He was on the second pitch of El Cracko when he fell. Authorities pronounced him dead at the scene and later rescued his stranded partner. The National Park Service urged climbers to adhere to safety precautions during descents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New Zealand navy passes through Taiwan strait for first time in years
item.description: The New Zealand Navy sailed a military vessel through the Taiwan Strait for the first time in seven years, alongside an Australian destroyer. This routine passage adheres to international law. Additionally, New Zealand condemned China's missile launch and cyberattacks, while considering joining the AUKUS security pact with Australia, the UK, and the US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
